Notice Identifier: Futureproofing the City of London Police
Title: Futureproofing the City of London Police
Description:
We are seeking external consultancy support to undertake an insights piece using existing data in the Force as well as macroeconomic data (open source and available from City of London Corporation) on the value and cost of the City of London Police to inform what we require out of the Police Funding Formula review. 

Output

The outputs we require from this work is twofold:
1)	We require collation of existing data sets within the City of London Police, open-source data and macroeconomic data held by the City of London Corporation and other publicly available data sets to enable us to monitor changing demand;

2)	A report setting out analysis of the proposed indicators for the Funding Formula (listed below), what it means for the City of London Police, identification of any missing indicators and an evidence base for what factors need to be considered given the Force's national responsibilities, capital city status and uniqueness. This should also explore what indicators should be considered for online fraud and cyber demand. The current proposed indications for the formula are:
o	Uniqueness of the City of London 
o	High-cost base
o	Inability to leverage council tax precept due to low resident population
o	Significant terrorist target due to the iconic nature of the City
o	A growing night-time economy and leisure destination (Destination City)
o	High density, transient population including workers and tourists
o	National responsibilities for fraud
o	Importance of factoring online crime demand into the formula 

Timeline

Due to the timing of the Police Funding Review, this work needs to be carried out at pace and we would require someone to begin this work from the beginning of April and deliver the outputs by no later than Friday 13th May 2022. We envisage that it would take 20 working days to deliver this work.

Title: Maths Support for Parents
Description:
Kent County Council is looking to procure an online maths subscription service aimed at parents of KS2 children. The purpose is to increase parents' confidence in their own maths ability and therefore to be able to support their children with learning at home. This service should be online to be as accessible to parents as possible. We are looking to reach 700 families (therefore 700 licenses).
The service must include a library of teaching videos which demonstrate how to teach a maths concept, examples could include, maths games videos with downloadable game boards and maths definition videos. Regular live stream maths workshops are also required to engage directly with parents and to offer opportunities to ask questions and develop their maths teaching skills.

Title: DDaT21174 Services for HR, Accounting, Reporting & Procurement (SHARP)
Description:
*** THIS IS AN AWARD NOTICE, NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITION***
This procurement is being concluded following a mini competition under the Crown Commercial Services (CCS) RM3821 Data and Application Solutions Lot1A

Contract is awarded with options to extend a further two years (1 year + 1 year).  Lowest value given is for initial 5 years. Highest value given is for full 7 years.

UK Shared Business Services is requiring a replacement for the ORACLE based system in order to continue to offer a high-level of service in regards to HR, Accounting, Reporting and Procurement services to our Customers.
The Services for HR, Accounting, Reporting and Procurement (SHARP) programme is born out of a need to replace an Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) solution where existing licence arrangements expire in December 2023. Existing ERP platforms deliver critical Payroll, HR, Finance and Procurement services, which organisations require in order to function.
The existing on-premise Oracle ERP platform is administered by UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS), for UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) and for UK SBS itself.

Organisation Name: Breckland District Council and South Holland District Council
Title: Architectural Services for Land Sites within the South Holland District - AWARD
Description:
The council and its housing delivery vehicles are proactively exploring a number of
      development on land assets owned by South Holland District Council.  These opportunities will serve to support the council in its aims of increasing the supply of new housing in the district for the benefit of local communities.
      
      In order to achieve the council's housing delivery ambitions, the authority is seeking to procure the services of an Architect to assist in the delivery of approximately 70 homes across three initially identified sites in the district. It is anticipated that each site will be run as an independent project but will maintain the same core team of designers and consultants to provide consistency. The three sites currently under consideration will be subject to scrutiny and review at selected gateways in line with the Councils governance process. It is anticipated that additional sites may be added to the programme as identified and it should also be noted that all sites may not progress beyond appropriate gateways should they not receive support.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [rg+p Limited|Waterloo House, 71 Princess Road West, Leicester, United Kingdom, LE1 6TR|NONE||No|No]

Title: English Riviera Food Festival
Description:
Torbay Council working with the English Riviera Bid Company would like to stage a high-quality food festival leading into the existing Seafood Coast initiative to exemplify the wealth of quality food and beverage available in the locality. The event is scheduled to take place over the weekend of 30 September 2022 to 2 October 2022 and initially will take place at Torre Abbey in Torquay. The ambition will be to expand the event to other areas of Torbay in future years as the event grows. 

It is envisaged that the event will incorporate a large number of quality food and beverage trade stands (including a mix of freshly cooked food and food to be prepared/consumed at home) as well as cooking demonstrations by local and celebrity chefs and food related and nutrition information stands.

Notice Identifier: 17/02/1078 Venue Services - CCS RM6217 Lot 4 - Travel & Venue Solutions
Title: 17/02/1078 Venue Services - CCS RM6217 Lot 4 - Travel & Venue Solutions
Description:
Venue Services Requirement 

Background 

The Business Support Team (BST) currently own the process for sourcing and booking venue and meeting room requirements.  Due to the Covid pandemic, there has been an increase in the number of external venue and meeting room requirements with Inspectors running virtual events.  For small scale individual requirements (i.e. 1 delegate, 1 day), the BST source venues themselves and have built up a pool of venues primarily used across the UK.  For large scale requirements (i.e. training, team meetings, 50+ delegates, number of days), PINS have utilised the venue services contract with Calder Conferences where best value and cost savings can be achieved. 

Requirement 

PINS have an ongoing requirement for the provision of venue finding services for meetings, booking of group accommodation and supporting services.   

Sourcing venues for meetings within the UK, 

Accommodation booking for 9 delegates or more, 

Supporting services including digital and hybrid meetings, 

Online and offline booking process via submission of booking request form, 

Management of bookings including amendments, cancellations and refunds.
DIrect Award

LEEDS

Title: Chichester District Council, Cleaning Contract  - AWARD
Description:
Chichester District Council is looking to procure a cleaning contractor to clear it's three premises and public conveniences, contact duration 3+1+1 years with a value of £1,500,000. 00
      
      The Council's full requirements and details of how to tender for this opportunity are available by clicking the Express Interest button. The deadline for tender submission is 2pm Monday 6th December 2021
      
      How to obtain the Tender Documents 
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sesharedservices/aspx/Tenders/Current. The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs, namely 'Tender', 'ITT - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. 
      
      Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details'. Continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents. Please download all the documents and read very carefully. 
      
      Opting In and Opting Out 
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 
      
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision. 
      
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'. 
      
      Further Guidance 
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender, download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge) can be found on the In-tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.

Organisation Name: Bath and North East Somerset Council
Title: Provision of Pianists in the  Pump Room, Bath
Description:
The Council wishes to establish a Contract for the provision of pianists at the Pump Room in Bath.  The Pump Room adjoins the Roman Baths Museum and music is an integral part of the Pump Room experience.

Music is provided by a Piano Trio comprising piano, violin and cello as well as also by solo pianists. 

Quality music in the Pump Room enhances the visitor experience, resulting in higher spend by diners and therefore, a greater financial return to the Council.

The purpose of this contract is to ensure the best possible musical provision for the Pump Room and in the case of the solo pianists, to ensure that the fees paid by the Council are competitive in the market.

Title: DurhamEnable External Evaluation
Description:
The primary objective of this contract is to provide an independent assessment of service provision, impact and future sustainability of the delivery model.  The evaluation will evidence the economic, social and environmental impact of DurhamEnable in County Durham.

The evaluation will be required to evidence the economic, social and environmental impact of DE in County Durham.

DurhamEnable is a Supported Employment service delivered by Durham County Council with funding from the European Social Fund. It supports people with learning disabilities, mental health needs, autism or long-term health conditions, to help them progress into paid employment. 

The service adopts a multi-agency approach to tackling the historically low employment rate for adults with Learning Disabilities and Autism in the county, providing intensive 1:1 Job Coach support for job seekers.

Title: Heritage Professional - Archives Project 'Remotely Digital'
Description:
Thanks to funding from the National Lottery Heritage Fund via 'Digital Volunteering' we are looking to appoint a heritage professional to manage a remote volunteering project with the aim of making the Barnsley Archives Sound and Film collection more accessible. The project will allow those who aren't able to physically visit us to work with and enjoy the collections.

We want to analyse, convert, interpret and facilitate the cataloguing of the Barnsley Sound and Film Archive held by Barnsley Archives and Local Studies. Remote volunteers will be trained to help with the processing, interpreting and transcribing. Volunteers will gain new skills and knowledge specific to the archive service and gain unique access to the collection.

We are looking for someone comfortable and confident with using digital technology, the handling, cataloguing, and working with collections and in training and development of volunteers using digital formats.

The appointed person would be supported by the Barnsley Museums Volunteer Coordinator, the Archives Manager and the wider archives team. There is also provision for volunteer needs as part of the funding.

Full brief attached in documents section and the value of tender is £25,000, the project is aimed to be completed by Dec 2022.

Title: NHSE538 General Dental Services in Scarborough
Description:
The Contracting Authority is procuring General Dental Services for Scarborough.

The Contracting Authority plans for a contract commencement date of 01 July 2022 for an initial contract term of 5-years with the option to extend the contract by 2-years at the discretion of the Contracting Authority and subject to satisfactory contractual and financial performance. 

The annual financial threshold is £1,035,164 GBP based on 27,241 Units of Dental Activity (UDA) at the rate of 30.40 GBP per UDA. 

The basic principles of the open procedure will be followed for this procurement to test the capability, capacity, and technical competence of bidders in accordance with The Light-Touch Rules Regime, Regulations 74 to 77 of The Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (as amended) (for health, social, education, and certain other service contracts). 

Tender documentation will be available from 10 January 2022 and the closing time and date for tender returns is 12:00 noon on 09 February 2022. 

"Under the Public Services (Social Value) Act 2012 Contracting Authorities must consider: (a) How what is proposed to be procured might improve the economic, social, and environmental well-being of the area where they exercise their functions; and (b) How, in conducting the process of procurement, they might act with a view to securing that improvement. 

Accordingly, the subject matter of the contract has been scoped to take into account the priorities of the Contracting Authority relating to "economic, social, and environmental well-being" by utilising the UK Governments Social Value Model. 

This procurement will be conducted using an e-Tendering portal (In-Tend). 

The In-Tend portal can be found at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/nhsnecsu/aspx/Home and search for the project NHSE538 Invitation to Tender - General Dental Services - Scarborough. 

Please note that it is free to register on In-Tend, which can be accessed at any time of day as long as you have a working internet connection. 

Should providers have any queries regarding In-Tend a dedicated help desk is available and can be contacted on +44 8442728810 or email: support@in-tend.co.uk. 

The Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006 (as amended) do not apply to this procurement; however bidders are advised to obtain their own legal advice and carry out due diligence. 

The Contracting Authority and NECS reserve the right to cancel the tender process at any point and will not be held liable for any costs resulting from any cancellation of the tender process or for any other costs incurred by those tendering for the contract.

Title: Ice Cream and Slush Concessions 2022  - 2023 - AWARD
Description:
Ice Cream and Slush Concessions 2022  - 2023
      
      Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council is inviting tender submissions from responsible and suitable operators to trade ice cream, slush, candy floss, confectionary and soft drinks only at a number of designated locations across Sandwell Valley Country Park and on Dartmouth Park play area. Designated locations are listed in the specification. 
      
      Term of Contract
      The concession will be for a one (1) year period commencing 1st April 2022 to 31st March 2023 with an option to extend for a further 12 months.   
      
      Value of Contract
      Operators will provide a cost for a one (1) year period for concession 2022/2023 and price will be awarded on the bidder whose proposal represents the highest bid. Concession period 2023/2024 is not a guaranteed year and operators will provide a cost for Information purposes only should the Sandwell Valley Management Team decide to invoke the option to extend the concession for a further 12 months.
      
      Payment Concession Fees
      Payment Concession Fees will remain fixed for the first 12 months of the contract. Making 2 payments per financial year. However, if the concession is extended for a further 12 months, a meeting with the Sandwell Valley Management Team and the successful operator will be held.
      
      Appointment of Service Provider
      To appoint a single provider for the provision of the Ice cream and Slush Concessions 2022-2023.
      
      The Council will be using the In-tend e-Tendering System for this Procurement exercise, please visit https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc to access the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.
      
      From here you will be able to register your company, express an interest in the opportunity, and gain immediate access to Quotation or other related documents.
      
      To submit a quotation, you will be required to 'Opt In'.
      
      For a Step by Step user guide to the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal please click on the `Guidance for Suppliers` section of the website. All procurement responses must be carried out via the Sandwell MBC In-tend Supplier Portal.  
      
      If you require further assistance in respect of the system please contact the In-tend support team on 0844 272 8810. 
      
      Closing date: Monday 07  March 2022 at 15:00hrs
